column4: how can I hibernate ubuntu, so I can allow the vbox it's on to give it more RAM?
it basically is crapping out from too many chromium windows being open
ubuntu
no
i want to hibernate the Guest so I can give the Guest more RAM
no
wtf is having more than 1 virtual open
i only have 1 guest machine running
you could have multiple vm instances running at once
that's why I said no
how does that make no sense to urlin2u
right
that's fine
i just want the ubuntu session to be saved to the harddrive
then I want to increase the RAM
and start it back up
i'm not asking how to add more ram
i'm asking how to save hte ubuntu session
you could create a snapshot of your current state
a.k.a. hibernate
that's fine, how do I do that?
oh, you mean using vbox
